attribute.tooltip: [children &inputOutputLabel; &MFNodeLabel; empty list] [X3DChildNode] Grouping nodes contain a list of children nodes. ข้อเสนอแนะ: Each grouping node defines a coordinate space for its children, relative to the coordinate space of its parent node. Thus transformations accumulate down the scene graph hierarchy.
attribute.name: children

attribute.tooltip: [clipBoundary &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec4fLabel; "0 1 0 1"] [0,1] clipBoundary is specified in fractions of the normal render surface in the sequence left/right/bottom/top. When children are rendered, the output will only appear in the specified subset of the render surface. ข้อเสนอแนะ: default value 0 1 0 1 indicates 0-1 left-to-right and 0-1 bottom-to-top, meaning full view.
attribute.name: clipBoundary

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Bounding box size: automatically calculated, can be specified as an optimization or constraint.
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "viewport"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes. Warning: X3D Schema has incorrect default value for containerField.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) Layout node is used as layout field of LayoutLayer and LayoutGroup nodes. Layout provides all parameters required to define the size, location and scale of a 2D rectangular region. ข้อเสนอแนะ: the align, offset, and offsetUnits fields are used to determine the location of the layout region.
element.name: Layout

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE คือการเรียกใช้ใหม่สำหรับโหนด DEF ID ที่ถูกประกาศไว้แล้ว (Reuse), แต่ไม่รวมถึงโหนดลูกอื่นๆและคุณลักษณะ (attribute) อื่นๆด้วย (ยกเว้น containerField ที่มีค่าที่แตกต่าง) ข้อเสนอแนะ: การใช้ USE สามารถเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพในการทำงานได้ (แบบที่ไม่ใช่การ duplicate โหนด) Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [align &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &LayoutAlignHorizontalValues; &LayoutAlignVerticalValues; "CENTER" "CENTER"] The align field values align the sized rectangle to an edge or center of the parent rectangle. Two quoted string values are provided. The first value is for horizontal direction (LEFT | CENTER | RIGHT) and the second value is for vertical direction (BOTTOM | CENTER | TOP). Examples: "CENTER" "CENTER" (default value), "LEFT" "TOP" or "RIGHT" "BOTTOM". Warning: two values (or possibly one value) only. Warning: if the align field has only one value, that value shall be "CENTER" and apply both horizontally and vertically. ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks".
attribute.name: align

attribute.tooltip: [offset &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFFloatLabel; 0 0] (-∞,∞) The values of the offset field are used to translate the location of this rectangle after the initial alignment. The offsetUnits field specifies how to interpret the offset field. Warning: two values only.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.tooltip: [offsetUnits &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &LayoutOffsetUnitsValues; "WORLD" "WORLD"] The offsetUnits field values are used to interprete the offset values. Two quoted string values are provided. The first value is for horizontal offset, and the second value is for vertical offset. Examples: "WORLD" "WORLD" (default value), "FRACTION" "FRACTION" or "PIXEL" "PIXEL". ข้อเสนอแนะ: If the value of the offsetUnits field is FRACTION, the size of the corresponding dimension is interpreted as a fraction of the corresponding parent’s dimension. Warning: two values only. ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks".
attribute.name: offsetUnits

attribute.tooltip: [scaleMode &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &LayoutScaleModeValues; "NONE" "NONE"] The scaleMode field specifies how the scale of the parent is modified. Two quoted string values are provided. The first value is for horizontal scale and the second value is for vertical scale. Examples: "NONE" "NONE" (default value), "FRACTION" "FRACTION", "STRETCH" "STRETCH" or "PIXEL" "PIXEL". ข้อเสนอแนะ: A scaleMode field value of NONE specifies that the corresponding scale value is not modified. Instead, the scale is inherited from its parent. Since a LayoutLayer node does not have a parent, the value of NONE reverts to FRACTION. ข้อเสนอแนะ: A scaleMode value of FRACTION specifies a scale in the corresponding direction so that one unit is equal to the dimension (width or height) of this rectangle. ข้อเสนอแนะ: a scaleMode value of STRETCH specifies a scale in the corresponding direction such that the resulting scale in the horizontal direction is equal to the scale in the vertical direction, thus producing a uniform scale. ข้อเสนอแนะ: a value of PIXEL specifies a scale in the corresponding direction such that one unit is equal to one pixel. Warning: two values only. ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks".
attribute.name: scaleMode

attribute.tooltip: [size &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFFloatLabel; 1 1] (0,∞) The two values in the size field define the width and height of the layout rectangle. The sizeUnits field specifies how to interpret the size values. Warning: two values only.
attribute.name: size

attribute.tooltip: [sizeUnits &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &LayoutOffsetUnitsValues; "WORLD" "WORLD"] The sizeUnits field values are used to interprete the offset values. Two quoted string values are provided. The first value is for horizontal size, and the second value is for vertical size. Examples: "WORLD" "WORLD" (default value), "FRACTION" "FRACTION" or "PIXEL" "PIXEL". ข้อเสนอแนะ: If the value of the sizeUnits field is FRACTION, the size of the corresponding dimension is interpreted as a fraction of the corresponding parent’s dimension. Warning: two values only. ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks".
attribute.name: sizeUnits

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) LayoutGroup is a Grouping node that can contain most nodes, whose children are related by a common layout within a parent layout. The layout field contains an X3DLayoutNode node that provides the information required to locate and size the layout region of the LayoutGroup node relative to its parent’s layout region. LayoutGroup content is clipped by the specified viewport node. ข้อเสนอแนะ: The origin of the node is always in the center of its layout region. Thus, children (with the exception of LayoutGroup) are specified in a coordinate system whose origin is located at the center of the rectangle and can be transformed from that location. Warning: a LayoutGroup can only be a child of a LayoutLayer node or another LayoutGroup node. ข้อเสนอแนะ: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. ข้อเสนอแนะ: LayoutGroup does not directly have any pixel-dependent concepts. However, it can contain a Layout node that does have pixel-specific options.
element.name: LayoutGroup

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE คือการเรียกใช้ใหม่สำหรับโหนด DEF ID ที่ถูกประกาศไว้แล้ว (Reuse), แต่ไม่รวมถึงโหนดลูกอื่นๆและคุณลักษณะ (attribute) อื่นๆด้วย (ยกเว้น containerField ที่มีค่าที่แตกต่าง) ข้อเสนอแนะ: การใช้ USE สามารถเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพในการทำงานได้ (แบบที่ไม่ใช่การ duplicate โหนด) Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [layout &inputOutputLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [X3DLayoutNode] The layout field contains an X3DLayoutNode node that provides the information required to locate and size the layout region of the LayoutGroup node relative to its parent’s layout region, and also to scale the contents of the LayoutGroup.
attribute.name: layout

attribute.tooltip: [viewport &inputOutputLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [X3DViewportNode] The content of the LayoutGroup is clipped by the specified viewport.
attribute.name: viewport

attribute.tooltip: [children &inputOutputLabel; &MFNodeLabel; empty list] [X3DChildNode] Grouping nodes contain a list of children nodes. ข้อเสนอแนะ: Each grouping node defines a coordinate space for its children, relative to the coordinate space of its parent node. Thus transformations accumulate down the scene graph hierarchy.
attribute.name: children

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Bounding box size: automatically calculated, can be specified as an optimization or constraint.
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) LayoutLayer is a Grouping node that can contain most nodes. LayoutLayer content is clipped by the specified viewport node. ข้อเสนอแนะ: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. Warning: better functional description needed in X3D specification.
element.name: LayoutLayer

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) ScreenFontStyle is an X3DFontStyleNode defines the size, family, justification, and other styles used within a screen layout. ScreenFontStyle renders text so that it appears identical to typical 2D applications by specifying pointSize in points (as in 2D document layout) rather than size in meters. Each glyph of text is rendered as a quadrilateral with a texture applied. ข้อเสนอแนะ: first add a Text node as a parent.
element.name: ScreenFontStyle

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย

Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [family &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFStringLabel; &FontStyleFamilyValues; "SERIF"] Array sequence of quoted font family names in preference order - browsers use the first supported family. Warning: font family support often varies. ข้อเสนอแนะ: values with guaranteed support include "SERIF" "SANS" "TYPEWRITER". ข้อเสนอแนะ: SERIF and SANS are variable-width fonts (for example, Roman and Arial). ข้อเสนอแนะ: TYPEWRITER is a fixed-width font (for example, Courier). ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks". ข้อเสนอแนะ: see 15.2.2.2 Font family and style http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/text.html#Fontfamilyandstyle for details.
attribute.name: family

attribute.tooltip: [style &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; &FontStyleStyleValues; PLAIN] Pick one of four values for text style. Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around this SFString enumeration value. ข้อเสนอแนะ: see 15.2.2.2 Font family and style http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/text.html#Fontfamilyandstyle for details.
attribute.name: style

attribute.tooltip: [justify &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFStringLabel; &FontStyleJustifyValues; "BEGIN" or "BEGIN" "END"]The justify field determines alignment of the above text layout relative to the origin of the object coordinate system. Warning: exactly two string values are provided for major and minor axis alignment. ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks". ข้อเสนอแนะ: see 15.2.2.3 Direction and justification http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/text.html#Directionandjustification for details.
attribute.name: justify

attribute.tooltip: [pointSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "12.0"] [0,∞) pointSize field specifies the size of text in points. Nominal height (in local coordinate system) of text glyphs Also sets default spacing between adjacent lines of text. ข้อเสนอแนะ: pointSize replaces the size field of the FontStyle node.
attribute.name: pointSize

attribute.tooltip: [spacing &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1.0"] [0,∞) Adjustment factor for line spacing between adjacent lines of text.
attribute.name: spacing

attribute.tooltip: [language &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Language codes consist of a primary code and a (possibly empty) series of subcodes. [ language-code = primary-code ( "-" subcode )* ] Two-letter primary codes are reserved for language abbreviations. [RFC1766, http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1766.txt] Two-letter primary codes include en (English), fr (French), de (German), it (Italian), nl (Dutch), el (Greek), es (Spanish), pt (Portuguese), ar (Arabic), he (Hebrew), ru (Russian), zh (Chinese), ja (Japanese), hi (Hindi), ur (Urdu), and sa (Sanskrit). Any two-letter subcode is understood to be a country code. Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values. ข้อเสนอแนะ: see ISO3166 or http://www.oasis-open.org/cover/iso639a.html
attribute.name: language

attribute.tooltip: [horizontal &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether text direction is horizontal (true) or vertical (false). ข้อเสนอแนะ: see 15.2.2.3 Direction and justification http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/text.html#Directionandjustification for details.
attribute.name: horizontal

attribute.tooltip: [leftToRight &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether text direction is left-to-right (true) or right-to-left (false). ข้อเสนอแนะ: see 15.2.2.3 Direction and justification http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/text.html#Directionandjustification for details.
attribute.name: leftToRight

attribute.tooltip: [topToBottom &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether text direction is top-to-bottom (true) or bottom-to-top (false). ข้อเสนอแนะ: see 15.2.2.3 Direction and justification http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/text.html#Directionandjustification for details.
attribute.name: topToBottom

attribute.tooltip: [body1AnchorPoint &outputOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel;] body1AnchorPoint describes anchorPoint position relative to local coordinate reference frame. ข้อเสนอแนะ: can detect separation if body1AnchorPoint!=body2AnchorPoint.

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) CollidableOffset repositions geometry relative to center of owning body. Contains a single CollidableShape or CollidableOffset node (containerField='collidable').

attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [appliedParameters &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; "BOUNCE"] Global parameters for collision system. Selectable values: "BOUNCE" "USER_FRICTION" "FRICTION_COEFFICIENT-2" "ERROR_REDUCTION" "CONSTANT_FORCE" "SPEED-1" "SPEED-2" "SLIP-1" "SLIP-2". Hints: BOUNCE: bounce value is used; USER_FRICTION: apply user-supplied value; FRICTION_COEFFICIENT-2: apply frictionCoefficients values; ERROR_REDUCTION: apply softnessErrorCorrection value; CONSTANT_FORCE: apply softnessConstantForceMix value; SPEED-1: apply first component of surfaceSpeed array; SPEED-2: apply second component of surfaceSpeed array; SLIP-1: apply first component of slipFactors array; SLIP-2: apply second component of slipFactors array.
attribute.name: appliedParameters

attribute.tooltip: [bounce &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,1] bounce indicates bounciness (0 = no bounce at all, 1 = maximum bounce).

attribute.name: minBounceSpeed

attribute.tooltip: [slipFactors &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec2fLabel; "0 0"] slipFactors used for computing surface drag.
attribute.name: slipFactors

attribute.tooltip: [softnessConstantForceMix &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,1] softnessConstantForceMix value applies a constant force value to make colliding surfaces appear to be somewhat soft.
attribute.name: softnessConstantForceMix

attribute.tooltip: [softnessErrorCorrection &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,1] softnessErrorCorrection indicates fraction of collision error fixed in a set of evaluations (0 = no error correction, 1 = all errors corrected in single step).

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE คือการเรียกใช้ใหม่สำหรับโหนด DEF ID ที่ถูกประกาศไว้แล้ว (Reuse), แต่ไม่รวมถึงโหนดลูกอื่นๆและคุณลักษณะ (attribute) อื่นๆด้วย (ยกเว้น containerField ที่มีค่าที่แตกต่าง) ข้อเสนอแนะ: การใช้ USE สามารถเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพในการทำงานได้ (แบบที่ไม่ใช่การ duplicate โหนด) Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [anchorPoint &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] anchorPoint is joint center, specified in world coordinates.
attribute.name: anchorPoint

attribute.tooltip: [axis &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] axis defines vector of joint connection between body1 and body2.
attribute.name: axis

attribute.tooltip: [forceOutput &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; "NONE"] forceOutput controls which output fields are generated for the next frame. Values are ALL, NONE, or exact names of output fields updated at start of next frame.
attribute.name: forceOutput

attribute.tooltip: [minAngle &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "-3.1416"] [-π,π] minAngle is minimum rotation angle for hinge.
attribute.name: minAngle

attribute.tooltip: [maxAngle &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "3.1416"] [-π,π] maxAngle is maximum rotation angle for hinge.
attribute.name: maxAngle

attribute.tooltip: [stopBounce &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,1] stopBounce is velocity factor for bounce back once stop point is reached. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 means no bounce, 1 means return velocity matches.
attribute.name: stopBounce

attribute.tooltip: [stopErrorCorrection &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.8"] [0,1] stopErrorCorrection is fraction of error correction performed during time step once stop point is reached. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 means no error correction, 1 means all error corrected in single step.
attribute.name: stopErrorCorrection

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "joints"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) DoubleAxisHingeJoint has two independent axes located around a common anchor point. axis1 has limits and a motor, axis 2 only has a motor Contains two RigidBody nodes (containerField values body1, body2). ข้อเสนอแนะ: RigidBodyPhysics component, level 2.
element.name: DoubleAxisHingeJoint

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย

Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [anchorPoint &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] anchorPoint is joint center, specified in world coordinates.
attribute.name: anchorPoint

attribute.tooltip: [axis1 &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] axis1 defines axis vector of joint connection to body1. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 0 0 means motor disabled.
attribute.name: axis1

attribute.tooltip: [axis2 &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] axis2 defines axis vector of joint connection to body2. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 0 0 means motor disabled.
attribute.name: axis2

attribute.tooltip: [desiredAngularVelocity1 &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] desiredAngularVelocity1 is goal rotation rate for hinge connection to body1.
attribute.name: desiredAngularVelocity1

attribute.tooltip: [desiredAngularVelocity2 &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] desiredAngularVelocity2 is goal rotation rate for hinge connection to body2.
attribute.name: desiredAngularVelocity2

attribute.tooltip: [forceOutput &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; "NONE"] forceOutput controls which output fields are generated for the next frame. Values are ALL, NONE, or exact names of output fields updated at start of next frame.
attribute.name: forceOutput

attribute.tooltip: [minAngle1 &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "-3.1416"] [-π,π] minAngle1 is minimum rotation angle for hinge.
attribute.name: minAngle1

attribute.tooltip: [maxAngle1 &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "3.1416"] [-π,π] maxAngle1 is maximum rotation angle for hinge.
attribute.name: maxAngle1

attribute.tooltip: [maxTorque1 &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] maxTorque1 is maximum rotational torque applied by corresponding motor axis to achieve desiredAngularVelocity1.
attribute.name: maxTorque1

attribute.tooltip: [maxTorque2 &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] maxTorque2 is maximum rotational torque applied by corresponding motor axis to achieve desiredAngularVelocity2.
attribute.name: maxTorque2

attribute.tooltip: [stop1Bounce &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,1] stop1Bounce is velocity factor for bounce back once stop point is reached. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 means no bounce, 1 means return velocity matches.
attribute.name: stop1Bounce

attribute.tooltip: [stop1ErrorCorrection &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.8"] [0,1] stop1ErrorCorrection is fraction of error correction performed during time step once stop point is reached. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 means no error correction, 1 means all error corrected in single step.
attribute.name: stop1ErrorCorrection

attribute.tooltip: [stop1ConstantForceMix &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.001"] [0,1] stop1ConstantForceMix value applies a constant force value to make colliding surfaces appear to be somewhat soft. ข้อเสนอแนะ: use with suspensionForce to improve softness and numerical stability. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 means no stop adjustment, 1 means springier stop response.
attribute.name: stop1ConstantForceMix

attribute.tooltip: [suspensionErrorCorrection &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.8"] [0,1] suspensionErrorCorrection describes how quickly the system resolves intersection errors due to floating point inaccuracies. ข้อเสนอแนะ: use with stop1ConstantForceMix to improve softness and numerical stability. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 means no stop adjustment, 1 means springier stop response.
attribute.name: suspensionErrorCorrection

attribute.tooltip: [suspensionForce &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.8"] [0,1] suspensionForce describes how quickly the system resolves intersection errors due to floating point inaccuracies. ข้อเสนอแนะ: use with stop1ConstantForceMix to improve softness and numerical stability. ข้อเสนอแนะ: 0 means no stop adjustment, 1 means springier stop response.
attribute.name: suspensionForce

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "joints"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) PickableGroup is a Grouping node that can contain most nodes. PickableGroup contains children that are marked as having a given classification of picking types, and can also enable or disable picking of the children. ข้อเสนอแนะ: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance.
element.name: PickableGroup

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE คือการเรียกใช้ใหม่สำหรับโหนด DEF ID ที่ถูกประกาศไว้แล้ว (Reuse), แต่ไม่รวมถึงโหนดลูกอื่นๆและคุณลักษณะ (attribute) อื่นๆด้วย (ยกเว้น containerField ที่มีค่าที่แตกต่าง) ข้อเสนอแนะ: การใช้ USE สามารถเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพในการทำงานได้ (แบบที่ไม่ใช่การ duplicate โหนด) Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [children &inputOutputLabel; &MFNodeLabel; empty list] [X3DChildNode] Grouping nodes contain a list of children nodes. ข้อเสนอแนะ: Each grouping node defines a coordinate space for its children, relative to the coordinate space of its parent node. Thus transformations accumulate down the scene graph hierarchy.
attribute.name: children

attribute.tooltip: [objectType &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &PickableGroupObjectTypeValues; "ALL"] The objectType field specifies a set of labels used in the picking process. Each string specified is treated as an independent label that needs to be matched against the same type in one of the pick sensor instances. Example: labeling a PickableGroup with the objectType value "WATER" and then attempting to intersect a pick sensor with objectType value "GROUND" fails since the objectType values do not match. Example: the special value "ALL" means that each node is available for picking regardless of the type specified by the pick sensor. Example: the special value "NONE" effectively disables all picking for this node and is the equivalent of setting the pickable field to false. ข้อเสนอแนะ: authors may define any value for objectType. ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks".
attribute.name: objectType

attribute.tooltip: [pickable &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] The pickable field determines whether pick traversal is performed on this node or its children. ข้อเสนอแนะ: pickable only affects children accessed through the transformation hierarchy of the parent. Warning: if one or more of the children of this instance is accessible through another transformation hierarchy through DEF/USE that still has picking enabled, they are still pickable through that path only.
attribute.name: pickable

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Bounding box size: automatically calculated, can be specified as an optimization or constraint.
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) LinePickSensor uses one or more pickingGeometry line segments to compute intersections with pickTarget shapes. As each line intersection generates a known point in space, useful event information is returned including normal, geometry and texCoord values. ข้อเสนอแนะ: sort order for line picking is based on each pair of coordinates that defining a line segment, with first declared vertex of the segment defined to be the start of the line to which the intersection points are closest. ข้อเสนอแนะ: when the picking line segment intersects a coplanar polygon, computed intersection point(s) are illustrated in Figure 38.1 http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/picking.html#f-LineIntersection ข้อเสนอแนะ: picking is performed between rendered frames of the event model. An author sets up the picking request in one frame by placing a LinePickSensor in the desired location. At the start of the next frame, any picking intersections are reported by the pick sensor. ข้อเสนอแนะ: picking notification is performed at the start of the frame for all enabled pick sensors once all other sensors are processed. ข้อเสนอแนะ: event timing details are explained in 4.4.8.3 Execution model http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/concepts.html#ExecutionModel
element.name: LinePickSensor

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE คือการเรียกใช้ใหม่สำหรับโหนด DEF ID ที่ถูกประกาศไว้แล้ว (Reuse), แต่ไม่รวมถึงโหนดลูกอื่นๆและคุณลักษณะ (attribute) อื่นๆด้วย (ยกเว้น containerField ที่มีค่าที่แตกต่าง) ข้อเสนอแนะ: การใช้ USE สามารถเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพในการทำงานได้ (แบบที่ไม่ใช่การ duplicate โหนด) Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables node operation.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive indicates when the intersecting object is picked by the picking geometry. Output event isActive=true is sent once a picked item is found. Output event isActive=false is sent once no picked item is found.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [intersectionType &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; &PickSensorIntersectionTypeValues; "BOUNDS"] intersectionType specifies precision of the collision computation. ข้อเสนอแนะ: intersectionType constants may be extended by the browser to provide additional options. Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values.
attribute.name: intersectionType

attribute.tooltip: [objectType &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &PickableGroupObjectTypeValues; "ALL"] The objectType field specifies a set of labels used in the picking process. Each string specified is treated as an independent label that needs to be matched against the same type in one of the pick sensor instances. Example: labeling a PickableGroup with the objectType value "WATER" and then attempting to intersect a pick sensor with objectType value "GROUND" fails since the objectType values do not match. Example: the special value "ALL" means that each node is available for picking regardless of the type specified by the pick sensor. Example: the special value "NONE" effectively disables all picking for this node and is the equivalent of setting the pickable field of the corresponding PickableGroup to false. ข้อเสนอแนะ: authors may define any value for objectType. ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks".
attribute.name: objectType

attribute.tooltip: [sortOrder &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; &PickSensorSortOrderValues; CLOSEST] The sortOrder field determines the order provided for picked output events. Example: ANY means that any single object can satisfy picking conditions for this pick sensor. Consistency of results is not guaranteed. Example: ALL means that every object that satisfies the picking conditions for this pick sensor shall be returned. Example: ALL_SORTED means that every object that satisfies the picking conditions for this pick sensor shall be returned with the order of the output fields provided in a distance-sorted order from closest to farthest away. The exact algorithm for sorting is defined by the individual node definitions. Example: CLOSEST means that the closest object by distance that satisfies the conditions of this pick sensor. *The exact algorithm for distance determination shall be defined by individual node definitions*. ข้อเสนอแนะ: browser implementations may define additional values and algorithms beyond these four required values. Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values.
attribute.name: sortOrder

attribute.tooltip: [pickingGeometry &inputOutputLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [IndexedLineSet|LineSet] pickingGeometry specifies the exact geometry coordinates that are used to perform the intersection testing of the picking operation.
attribute.name: pickingGeometry

attribute.tooltip: [pickTarget &inputOutputLabel; &MFNodeLabel; empty list] [X3DGroupingNode|X3DShapeNode|Inline] pickTarget specifies the list of nodes against which picking operations are performed. All nodes declared in this field and their descendents are evaluated for intersections.
attribute.name: pickTarget

attribute.tooltip: [pickedGeometry &outputOnlyLabel; &MFNodeLabel; #FIXED ""] Output event containing the node or nodes that have been found to intersect with the picking geometry from the last time this node performed a picking operation, given in the local coordinate system.
attribute.name: pickedGeometry

attribute.tooltip: [pickedPoint &outputOnlyLabel; &MFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] Output event containing 3D points on surface of underlying pickingGeometry computed by the picking intersection computations, given in the local coordinate system.
attribute.name: pickedPoint

attribute.tooltip: [pickedNormal &outputOnlyLabel; &MFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] Output event containing surface normal vectors computed by the picking intersection computations.
attribute.name: pickedNormal

attribute.tooltip: [pickedTextureCoordinate &outputOnlyLabel; &MFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] Output event containing 3D texture coordinates of surfaces computed by the picking intersection computations. Picked texture coordinates are in three dimensions. If the target texture coordinate has two dimensions, the third coordinate (z component of an SFVec3f) shall be zero. Warning: if the target object has multiple textures defined, only texture coordinates for the first texture are returned and all other textures are ignored.
attribute.name: pickedTextureCoordinate

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) PointPickSensor tests one or more pickingGeometry points in space as lying inside the provided pickTarget geometry. For each pickingGeometry PointSet coordinate point that lies inside the pickTarget geometry, a pickedPoint coordinate is returned along with a corresponding pickedGeometry node inside which the point lies. ข้อเสนอแนะ: because points represent an infinitely small location in space, sortOrder values CLOSEST and ALL_SORTED are defined to mean ANY and ALL respectively. ข้อเสนอแนะ: picking is performed between rendered frames of the event model. An author sets up the picking request in one frame by placing a LinePickSensor in the desired location. At the start of the next frame, any picking intersections are reported by the pick sensor. ข้อเสนอแนะ: picking notification is performed at the start of the frame for all enabled pick sensors once all other sensors are processed. ข้อเสนอแนะ: event timing details are explained in 4.4.8.3 Execution model http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/concepts.html#ExecutionModel
element.name: PointPickSensor

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย

attribute.tooltip: [pickTarget &inputOutputLabel; &MFNodeLabel; empty list] [X3DGroupingNode|X3DShapeNode|Inline] pickTarget specifies the list of nodes against which picking operations are performed. All nodes declared in this field and their descendents are evaluated for intersections.
attribute.name: pickTarget

attribute.tooltip: [pickedGeometry &outputOnlyLabel; &MFNodeLabel; #FIXED ""] Output event containing the node or nodes that have been found to intersect with the picking geometry from the last time this node performed a picking operation, given in the local coordinate system.
attribute.name: pickedGeometry

attribute.tooltip: [pickedPoint &outputOnlyLabel; &MFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] Output event containing 3D points on surface of underlying pickingGeometry computed by the picking intersection computations, given in the local coordinate system.
attribute.name: pickedPoint

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) PrimitivePickSensor tests picking intersections using one of the basic primitive shapes specified in the pickingGeometry field [Cone|Cylinder|Sphere|Box] against the pickTarget geometry. Warning: boolean fields used to control visibility of primitive pickingGeometry subsections are ignored when evaluating picking intersections. Example: a Cylinder without end caps is still treated as an enclosed Cylinder. ข้อเสนอแนะ: Sorting is defined based on the primitive type as follows. For Cone, the closest picked primitive is defined to be that closest to the vertex point. For Cylinder, Box, and Sphere, the closest picked primitive is defined to be that closest to the center. ข้อเสนอแนะ: picking is performed between rendered frames of the event model. An author sets up the picking request in one frame by placing a LinePickSensor in the desired location. At the start of the next frame, any picking intersections are reported by the pick sensor. ข้อเสนอแนะ: picking notification is performed at the start of the frame for all enabled pick sensors once all other sensors are processed. ข้อเสนอแนะ: event timing details are explained in 4.4.8.3 Execution model http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/concepts.html#ExecutionModel
element.name: PrimitivePickSensor

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE คือการเรียกใช้ใหม่สำหรับโหนด DEF ID ที่ถูกประกาศไว้แล้ว (Reuse), แต่ไม่รวมถึงโหนดลูกอื่นๆและคุณลักษณะ (attribute) อื่นๆด้วย (ยกเว้น containerField ที่มีค่าที่แตกต่าง) ข้อเสนอแนะ: การใช้ USE สามารถเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพในการทำงานได้ (แบบที่ไม่ใช่การ duplicate โหนด) Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables node operation.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive indicates when the intersecting object is picked by the picking geometry. Output event isActive=true is sent once a picked item is found. Output event isActive=false is sent once no picked item is found.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [intersectionType &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; &PickSensorIntersectionTypeValues; "BOUNDS"] intersectionType specifies precision of the collision computation. ข้อเสนอแนะ: intersectionType constants may be extended by the browser to provide additional options. Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values.
attribute.name: intersectionType

attribute.tooltip: [objectType &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &PickableGroupObjectTypeValues; "ALL"] The objectType field specifies a set of labels used in the picking process. Each string specified is treated as an independent label that needs to be matched against the same type in one of the pick sensor instances. Example: labeling a PickableGroup with the objectType value "WATER" and then attempting to intersect a pick sensor with objectType value "GROUND" fails since the objectType values do not match. Example: the special value "ALL" means that each node is available for picking regardless of the type specified by the pick sensor. Example: the special value "NONE" effectively disables all picking for this node and is the equivalent of setting the pickable field of the corresponding PickableGroup to false. ข้อเสนอแนะ: authors may define any value for objectType. ข้อเสนอแนะ: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so "separate each individual string" "by using quote marks".
attribute.name: objectType

attribute.tooltip: [sortOrder &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; &PickSensorSortOrderValues; CLOSEST] The sortOrder field determines the order provided for picked output events. Example: ANY means that any single object can satisfy picking conditions for this pick sensor. Consistency of results is not guaranteed. Example: ALL means that every object that satisfies the picking conditions for this pick sensor shall be returned. Example: ALL_SORTED means that every object that satisfies the picking conditions for this pick sensor shall be returned with the order of the output fields provided in a distance-sorted order from closest to farthest away. The exact algorithm for sorting is defined by the individual node definitions. Example: CLOSEST means that the closest object by distance that satisfies the conditions of this pick sensor. *The exact algorithm for distance determination shall be defined by individual node definitions*. ข้อเสนอแนะ: browser implementations may define additional values and algorithms beyond these four required values. Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values.
attribute.name: sortOrder

attribute.tooltip: [pickingGeometry &inputOutputLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [Cone|Cylinder|Sphere|Box] pickingGeometry specifies the exact geometry coordinates that are used to perform the intersection testing of the picking operation.
attribute.name: pickingGeometry

attribute.tooltip: [pickTarget &inputOutputLabel; &MFNodeLabel; empty list] [X3DGroupingNode|X3DShapeNode|Inline] pickTarget specifies the list of nodes against which picking operations are performed. All nodes declared in this field and their descendents are evaluated for intersections.
attribute.name: pickTarget

attribute.tooltip: [pickedGeometry &outputOnlyLabel; &MFNodeLabel; #FIXED ""] Output event containing the node or nodes that have been found to intersect with the picking geometry from the last time this node performed a picking operation, given in the local coordinate system.
attribute.name: pickedGeometry

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) VolumePickSensor tests picking intersections using the pickingGeometry [X3DGeometryNode] volume against the pickTarget geometry volume. ข้อเสนอแนะ: sort order is based on distance between centers of the bounds of the picking geometry and the picked geometry. Warning: pickingGeometry volume is defined by the convex hull of the enclosing planes of the provided X3DGeometryNode. If the provided volume is not manifold, pick results are undefined. ข้อเสนอแนะ: a pick is successful if any vertex of the pickTarget geometry intersects the volume defined by the pickingGeometry. ข้อเสนอแนะ: Sorting is defined based on distance between the centers of the bounds of the picking geometry and the picked geometry. ข้อเสนอแนะ: picking is performed between rendered frames of the event model. An author sets up the picking request in one frame by placing a LinePickSensor in the desired location. At the start of the next frame, any picking intersections are reported by the pick sensor. ข้อเสนอแนะ: picking notification is performed at the start of the frame for all enabled pick sensors once all other sensors are processed. ข้อเสนอแนะ: event timing details are explained in 4.4.8.3 Execution model http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/concepts.html#ExecutionModel
element.name: VolumePickSensor

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE คือการเรียกใช้ใหม่สำหรับโหนด DEF ID ที่ถูกประกาศไว้แล้ว (Reuse), แต่ไม่รวมถึงโหนดลูกอื่นๆและคุณลักษณะ (attribute) อื่นๆด้วย (ยกเว้น containerField ที่มีค่าที่แตกต่าง) ข้อเสนอแนะ: การใช้ USE สามารถเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพในการทำงานได้ (แบบที่ไม่ใช่การ duplicate โหนด) Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [order &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFInt32Label; "3"] [0,5] order defines the number of internal filters (larger means smoother response, longer delay).
attribute.name: order

attribute.tooltip: [tau &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0.3"] [0,∞) tau is the exponential-decay time constant for filter response in seconds.
attribute.name: tau

attribute.tooltip: [tolerance &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] -1 or [0,∞) Absolute value for satisfactory completion proximity (-1 lets browser choose).
attribute.name: tolerance

attribute.tooltip: [initialValue &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Initial starting value for this node.
attribute.name: initialValue

attribute.tooltip: [initialDestination &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Initial destination value for this node.
attribute.name: initialDestination

attribute.tooltip: [set_value &inputOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] set_value resets current value of this node.
attribute.name: set_value

attribute.tooltip: [set_destination &inputOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] set_destination resets destination value of this node.
attribute.name: set_destination

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive true/false events are sent when follower-node computation starts/stops.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [value_changed &outputOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] Computed output value that approaches within tolerance of destination value, as determined by elapsed time, order and tau.
attribute.name: value_changed

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) PositionDamper2D generates a series of 2D floating-point values that progressively change from initial value to destination value. ข้อเสนอแนะ: value_changed output events can be ROUTEd to a <TextureTransform> node's translation field, for example.

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables node operation.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [force &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 -9.8 0"] (-∞,∞) force field indicates strength and direction of the propelling force on the particles (e.g. default is Earth's gravity). ข้อเสนอแนะ: force is specified in force base units (usually newtons). ข้อเสนอแนะ: if particles have zero mass, ForcePhysicsModel node has no effect.
attribute.name: force

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "physics"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) ParticleSystem specifies a complete particle system. It can contain Appearance for particle appearance, a geometry node if gemoetryType='GEOMETRY', a colorRamp Color/ColorRGBA node for changing base color over each particle's lifetime, a texcoordRamp TextureCoordinate node to control texture coordinates of provided texture(s) in the Appearance node over time, a single emitter X3DParticleEmitterNode, and an array of physics X3DParticlePhysicsModelNode nodes. ข้อเสนอแนะ: event timing details are explained in 4.4.8.3 Execution model http://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/concepts.html#ExecutionModel
element.name: ParticleSystem

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF เป็นการกำหนดชื่อ ID เฉพาะสำหรับโหนดซึ่งสามารถอ้างอิงได้จากโหนดอื่น ข้อเสนอแนะ: ชื่อ DEF ควรมีความชัดเจน บ่งบอกถึงโหนดนั้นว่าคืออะไรหรือทำอะไรอย่างมีความหมาย
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE คือการเรียกใช้ใหม่สำหรับโหนด DEF ID ที่ถูกประกาศไว้แล้ว (Reuse), แต่ไม่รวมถึงโหนดลูกอื่นๆและคุณลักษณะ (attribute) อื่นๆด้วย (ยกเว้น containerField ที่มีค่าที่แตกต่าง) ข้อเสนอแนะ: การใช้ USE สามารถเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพในการทำงานได้ (แบบที่ไม่ใช่การ duplicate โหนด) Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: แต่ละค่าของ USE จะต้องตรงกับค่า DEF ที่ถูกประกาศก่อนหน้าใน Scene นั้น
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [appearance &inputOutputLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [X3DAppearanceNode] The appearance field holds an Appearance node that is used for the geometry. All effects, such as material colours and/or multi-textures, are applied to each particle. ข้อเสนอแนะ: if a texture coordinate ramp and key is supplied with this geometry, it shall be used in preference to any automatic texture coordinate generation. ข้อเสนอแนะ: if automatic texture coordinate generation is used, results shall be based on the entire volume that the particles consume, not locally applied to each particle.
attribute.name: appearance

attribute.tooltip: [colorKey &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] [0,∞) Array of time intervals in seconds, corresponding to particle lifetime, that are used to interpolate colorRamp array values. ข้อเสนอแนะ: color values are interpolated in linear Hue Saturation Value (HSV) space, similar to ColorInterpolator node. ข้อเสนอแนะ: color values are defined as per-vertex colour values. Warning: if an Appearance and Material nodes are provided, those material properties override colorRamp interpolation. ข้อเสนอแนะ: number of colorKey values must match length of the per-vertex colorRamp arrays!
attribute.name: colorKey

attribute.tooltip: [colorRamp &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [X3DColorNode] The colorRamp Color/ColorRGBA node holds a series of colour values to be used at the given colorKey points in time. ข้อเสนอแนะ: color values are defined as per-vertex colour values. Warning: if an Appearance and Material nodes are provided, those material properties override colorRamp interpolation. ข้อเสนอแนะ: number of colorKey values must match length of the per-vertex colorRamp arrays!
attribute.name: colorRamp

attribute.tooltip: [emitter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [X3DParticleEmitterNode] The emitter field specifies the type of emitter geometry and properties that the particles are given for their initial positions.
attribute.name: emitter

attribute.tooltip: [geometryType &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; &ParticleSystemGeometryTypes; QUAD] specifies type of geometry used to represent individual particles. Typically, a particle is calculated as point in space at which the geometry is placed. Changing the value of the geometry field or the definition of the geometry node shall be applied during current computation of the next frame to be rendered. ข้อเสนอแนะ: LINE means that a line is drawn along the particle's current velocity vector, for this frame, centered about the particle's position. The length of the line is specified by the particle's height from the particleSize field value. ข้อเสนอแนะ: POINT means that a point geometry is rendered at the particle's position. ข้อเสนอแนะ: QUAD means that a 2D quad is rendered aligned in the local coordinate space of the particle system with the face normal pointing along the positive Z axis. Individual quads are not aligned to the user's eye position but are affected in depth by the physics model. The particle's position is at the center of the quad. ข้อเสนอแนะ: SPRITE means that a point sprite that uses a 2D point position to locate a screen-aligned quad at the center of the particle's location is rendered. ข้อเสนอแนะ: TRIANGLE means that a 2D quad is rendered using a pair of triangles aligned in the local coordinate space of the particle system with the face normal pointing along the positive Z axis. Individual triangles are not aligned to the user's eye position, but are affected in depth by the physics model. The particle's position is at the center of the triangle. ข้อเสนอแนะ: GEOMETRY means that the geometry specified by the geometry field is rendered for each particle using the local coordinate system. Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around this SFString enumeration value.
attribute.name: geometryType

attribute.tooltip: [geometry &inputOutputLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [X3DGeometryNode] The geometry node provides geometry used for each particle when geometryType=GEOMETRY.
attribute.name: geometry

attribute.tooltip: [physics &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFNodeLabel; empty list] [X3DParticlePhysicsModelNode] After being created, the individual particles are then manipulated according to the physics model(s) specified in the physics field.
attribute.name: physics

attribute.tooltip: [createParticles &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables creation of new particles, while any existing particles remain in existence and continue to animate until the end of their lifetimes. ข้อเสนอแนะ: if no particles are left in scene, system is considered both active and enabled.
attribute.name: createParticles

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables node operation.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [lifetimeVariation &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.25"] [0,1) TODO not properly defined in X3D spedification. Multiplier for the randomness used to control the range of possible output values. The bigger the value, the more random the output and the bigger the range of initial values possible. ข้อเสนอแนะ: variation of zero does not allow any randomness.
attribute.name: lifetimeVariation

attribute.tooltip: [maxParticles &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "200"] [0,∞] Maximum number of particles to be generated at one time (subject to player limitations).
attribute.name: maxParticles

attribute.tooltip: [particleLifetime &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "5"] [0,∞) TODO not properly defined in X3D spedification. Particle animation lifetime in base time units (default is seconds).
attribute.name: particleLifetime

attribute.tooltip: [particleSize &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec2fLabel; "0.02 0.02"] [0,∞) particleSize describes width and height dimensions for each particle in length base units (default is meters). Changing this value dynamically will only change new particles created after the change. ข้อเสนอแนะ: particles created before this timestamp will remain at the old size. ข้อเสนอแนะ: his field only effects particles using LINE, QUAD, SPRITE, and TRIANGLE geometry types.
attribute.name: particleSize

attribute.tooltip: [texCoordKey &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] [0,∞) Array of time intervals in seconds, corresponding to particle lifetime, that are used to sequence texCoordRamp array values. ข้อเสนอแนะ: no interpolation is performed, texture coordinates are simply sequenced in order. ข้อเสนอแนะ: texture-coordinate values map textures to vertices in the geometry. ข้อเสนอแนะ: number of texCoordKey values must match length of the per-vertex texCoordRamp arrays!
attribute.name: texCoordKey

attribute.tooltip: [texCoordRamp &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFNodeLabel; NULL] [TextureCoordinate] texture coordinates of the provided texture(s) in the Appearance node, over time. Particle systems frequently like to change the texture on a particle as it ages, yet there is no good way of accomplishing this through standard interpolators because interpolators have no concept of particle time. This pair of fields hold time-dependent values for the texture coordinates to be applied to the particle. When a particle reaches the next time stamp it moves to the next set of texture coordinates. ข้อเสนอแนะ: texture-coordinate values map textures to vertices in the geometry. ข้อเสนอแนะ: number of texCoordKey values must match length of the per-vertex texCoordRamp arrays!
attribute.name: texCoordRamp

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive true/false events are sent when playback starts/stops.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Bounding box size: automatically calculated, can be specified as an optimization or constraint.
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) PointEmitter generates particles from a specific point in space using the specified direction and speed.
element.name: PointEmitter

attribute.name: USE

attribute.name: direction

attribute.tooltip: [position &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 1 0"] Point from which particles emanate.
attribute.name: position

attribute.tooltip: [mass &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,∞) Basic mass of each particle in mass base units (default is grams). ข้อเสนอแนะ: mass is needed if gravity or other force-related calculations are performed per-particle.
attribute.name: mass

attribute.tooltip: [speed &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,∞) Initial linear speed (default is m/s) imparted to all particles along their direction of movement.
attribute.name: speed

attribute.tooltip: [surfaceArea &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,∞) Particle surface area in area base units (default is meters squared). Surface area is used for calculations such as wind effects per particle. ข้อเสนอแนะ: surfaceArea value represents average frontal area presented to the wind. ข้อเสนอแนะ: assumes spherical model for each particle (i.e., surface area is the same regardless of direction).
attribute.name: surfaceArea

attribute.tooltip: [variation &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.25"] [0,∞) Multiplier for the randomness used to control the range of possible output values. The bigger the value, the more random the output and the bigger the range of possible initial values possible. ข้อเสนอแนะ: variation of zero does not allow any randomness.
attribute.name: variation

attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) PolylineEmitter emits particles along a single polyline. The coordinates for the line along which particles should be randomly generated are taken from a combination of the coord and coordIndex fields. The starting point for generating particles is randomly distributed along this line and given the initial speed and direction. ข้อเสนอแนะ: if no coordinates are available, PolylineEmitter acts like a point source located at local origin.
element.name: PolylineEmitter

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) SurfaceEmitter generates particles from the surface of an object. New particles are generated by first randomly choosing a face on the tessellated geometry and then a random position on that face. Particles are generated with an initial direction of the normal to that point (including any normal averaging due to normalPerVertex and creaseAngle field settings). ข้อเสนอแนะ: ff surface is not solid (solid=false), randomly choose from which side of the surface to emit, negating the normal direction when generating from the back side. Warning: only valid geometry shall be used.
element.name: SurfaceEmitter

Surface area is used for calculations such as wind effects per particle. ข้อเสนอแนะ: surfaceArea value represents average frontal area presented to the wind. ข้อเสนอแนะ: assumes spherical model for each particle (i.e., surface area is the same regardless of direction).
attribute.name: surfaceArea

attribute.tooltip: [variation &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.25"] [0,∞) Multiplier for the randomness used to control the range of possible output values. The bigger the value, the more random the output and the bigger the range of possible initial values possible. ข้อเสนอแนะ: variation of zero does not allow any randomness.
attribute.name: variation

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "emitter"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. ข้อเสนอแนะ: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: (v3.2 or later) WindPhysicsModel applies a wind effect to the particles. The wind includes a random variation factor to model gustiness.

attribute.name: enabled

attribute.name: direction

attribute.tooltip: [gustiness &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.1"] [0,∞) gustiness specifies how much wind speed varies from the average speed. ข้อเสนอแนะ: wind speed variation is calculated once per frame and applied equally to all particles.
attribute.name: gustiness

attribute.tooltip: [speed &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.1"] [0,∞) Initial linear speed (default is m/s) imparted to all particles along their direction of movement.
attribute.name: speed

attribute.tooltip: [turbulence &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.1"] [0,1] turbulence field specifies how much the wind acts directly in line with the direction, and how much variation is applied in directions other than the wind direction. ข้อเสนอแนะ: this is determined per-particle to model how each is effected by turbulence.
attribute.name: turbulence

element.tooltip: (v3.3 or later) A unit statement defines data conversion factors for a scene. ข้อเสนอแนะ: unit tag(s) are optional secondary children of head tag (add a head tag and optionally any component elements first).
element.name: unit

attribute.tooltip: [name &SFStringLabel; #REQUIRED] user-defined name for this conversion factor (for example, FeetToMeters).

element.tooltip: (v3.3 or later) IsoSurfaceVolumeData displays one or more surfaces extracted from a voxel dataset. A surface is defined as the boundary between regions in the volume where the voxel values are larger than a given value (the iso value) on one side of the boundary and smaller on the other side, and the gradient magnitude is larger than surfaceTolerance. ข้อเสนอแนะ: The SFNode gradients field may be used to provide explicit per-voxel gradient direction information for determining surface boundaries rather than having it implicitly calculated by the implementation.

If surfaceValues has more than one value defined, ignore contourStepSize and render surfaces corresponding to listed surfaceValues.

attribute.tooltip: [type &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; &ProjectionVolumeStyleTypeValues; MAX] If type=MAX then Maximum Intensity Projection (MIP) or Least MIP (LMIP) algorithm is used to generate output color. If type=MIN then Minimum Intensity Projection algorithm is used. If type=AVERAGE then all voxels along ray are averaged. ข้อเสนอแนะ: type=AVERAGE matches a simple approximation of an X-ray.#10;Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around this SFString enumeration value.
attribute.name: type
